title: Sharks & Rays
description: Explore the world of sharks and rays, ancient predators that have roamed the oceans for hundreds of millions of years.

questions.question: How long have sharks existed on Earth?
What is the largest species of shark alive today?
Shark skeletons are made entirely of what material instead of bone?
The hammerhead shark's wide head helps it with what ability?
options: Enhanced electroreception and wider field of vision

questions.question: Which ray species can deliver a powerful electric shock of up to 220 volts?
The great white shark can detect a single drop of blood in how much water?
Manta rays are the largest rays in the world. What do they primarily eat?
How many rows of teeth can a shark go through in its lifetime?
The cookiecutter shark gets its name from doing what?
options: Having spots that look like cookies
Taking round, cookie-shaped bites from larger animals

questions.question: Which shark species is known for being able to survive in both salt and fresh water?
The Greenland shark is notable for what remarkable characteristic?
options: It can live for over 400 years

questions.question: What special organ allows sharks to detect the electrical fields of other animals?
The basking shark is the second-largest fish. How does it feed?
options: Filter feeding with its enormous mouth open
